abstract: Criminal trial against International Monetary Fund director Christine Lagarde begins in Paris after plea for postponement is denied; ex-finance minister of France is charged with negligence resulting in misuse of public funds; allegations stem from 2007 case she arbitrated between  bank Credit Lyonnais and politically connected businessman Bernard Tapie.
lead_paragraph: The case caps a long-running legal drama that has captivated the public and exposed ties between powerful politicians and the wealthy.

headline.main: Christine Lagarde on Trial in France, Overshadowing I.M.F. Role
headline.print_headline: Trial Begins for I.M.F. Chief Accused of Negligence While France’s Finance Minister
